manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Description:Illuminating cordless mouse with 7-color backlight changeable in cycling modes: Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet and Mix etc 1.Wireless mouse(2.4Ghz) Enjoy the fast data transmission by convenience of the wireless technology. 2.Keys&functions: 6 keys+DPI (left, roller,right,forward,backward and DPI) . 3.DPI: 800 1600 2400 speed up to your needs. 4.Connection port: USB Nano receiver,plug and play directly. 5.Working distance 10±2m ensure your accurate cursor fixing. 6.Power :rechargeable Li-polymer battery built-in. Power capacity: 500mAh normally use span=1 month after fully charged . 7.Compatibility: Android, Linux, Windows95/98/XP/2000/VISTA/ Windows 7/8/10/ or Mac OS10.5.1 and other latest versions for desktop, laptop, PC, MacBook and other devices, USB Port 8. Feel-Good Design: Contoured shape and textured rubber grips,USB Nano Receiver stored within the back of the mouse. 9.Dimensions: 120*62*33 mm Illuminating Display: 1.Power button at bottom has 3 functions: Stage 1--Power Off(when you get ). Stage 2--power ON and mouse ready without illuminating. Stage 3--mouse ready with illuminating display on 2.Seven colors displaying in circulation automatically by breathing mode. 3.Level 1 sleeping:in 3 minutes/Level 2 sleeping in 15 minutes. 4.Wake up:activated by clicking any key when come back Recharging: 1.when the mouse not works smooth indicates low power 2.Use the USB—mini USB cable to recharge 3.when the blue light in the wheel turns off,it indicates fully recharged Package included: 1x Mouse 1x User manual 1x USB receiver(inserted at the bottom) 1x cable for power recharging Color available: Black -ASIN: B07MXMP48W SKU: CI-LBDJ-QCHP

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wireless mouse with precise movement and vivid color
reviews.reviewText: I really like how well it responds to hand movement. The scroll is precise. The colors are so vivid on my mouse. A colorful glow making it easy to see and use in dim light. My order came quickly and very good price for such a quality wireless mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for a Young Gamer's Desktop
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a wireless mouse for part of my youngest brother's birthday gift. As he had a LED-customized keyboard, I figured he could have a mouse that had LED lights as well. I was looking for a fairly priced but comfortable design. The order came in promptly, and after a quick setup, my brother was happy to announce his satisfaction and even kept insisting I see his new desktop layout. My brother liked the quietness of the click and the fluidity of the movement. So I'll say this one was a win.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This mouse lates for a long time on the rechargeable battery. I get lots of complements on this and my coworkers want it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Nice smooth control, and very quiet button clicks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Price. Good Mouse. A few key drawbacks.
reviews.reviewText: Overall, if the cons below don't bother you, this is a solid mouse to buy. I'll be keeping this mouse and using it as a traveling mouse to go with my laptop, but I've decided not to use it as my everyday mouse.I'll start off listing the Cons, then get to the Pros.Cons:*I don't like the 3 built-in DPI settings, so I have to customize my mouse speed via my computer settings. This is true both on my PC tower and my MacBook Air. I've found another around this price point that meets my needs with more DPI settings and software support.*Bad for people with smaller hands. I have to "reach" for the click buttons and the forward/backward buttons.*USB dongle is stiff going into the USB port. This is actually a pro if you're using it in one location. If you're switching between PC and laptop like I am, the stiffness makes me feel like I'm going to break the dongle every time I pull it out of the USB port.Pros:*Very quiet click.*The design and color changing is a nice visual.*Good mouse for the price point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded all expectations
reviews.reviewText: I've worked in IT for 20+ yrs so I've used just about every brand and type of mouse there is at some point. This looked kinda cool so I bought it on a whim but was honestly skeptical that it would work very well. But it's really exceeded all expectations I had for it, and some I DIDN'T have...LoL. It's worked flawlessly since the first day, no issues with the lighting or the DPI settings which surprisingly have worked perfectly as well. Has good battery life and fully charges in only about an HR, and it can be used while charging too. So it's basically always working, no matter what, no more batteries needed...ever. There's just really nothing negative I can think to say about it... Would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: its smooth and it lights up it does everything they say it does overall really good buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Colorful & silent but so sensitive!
reviews.reviewText: Day 1 of usage: no manual included in box but not a big deal. I can google if I have a question, I suppose. I needed a wireless mouse because my jerk of a cat chewed through the cord of my last one.It is very colorful & is easy to use, just plug in to charge & use. I have no idea what the DPI button on top of the mouse is for. There are two buttons on the left side and it goes back (upper) and forward (lower button) on whatever webpage you're on.The switch on the bottom of my mouse seems to be the opposite of what is shown in the description of the product. When it's in the up position, my mouse is off, and the bottom position turns it on & cycles the light. Not sure what the middle position is yet-just w/o illumination as far as I can tell.It's a decent mouse, longer than the usual logitech one and seems pretty responsive with my Dell laptop. The silent click is something I haven't really thought about as an option. Now it seems really loud when I type on the keyboard since my mouse has a silent click! LOL. Will update review after more use. All in all, a good buy!It is now day 365+ I honestly have not used this more than a handful of times. I tried it out while I was teleworking and the dang thing is SO SENSITIVE that it jumps all over and selects things randomly! Since I work with financial docs I couldn't rely on this peripheral to do my job accurately. There's no room for mistakes! It was also moving folders around, etc.!I guess it's just a pretty light-up mouse, unfortunately. Wished I could return it! Waste of money for sure!
